summary: This document is a set of 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. The sheets record staff checks on inmates in continuous locked-down status across multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, M, L, ZB). The document is significant as it provides a detailed log of the observation schedule on the night Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.

events.title: Inmate Observation Logs
events.description: Detailed 30-minute observation check sheets were completed for inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York, documenting staff rounds throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log detailing 30-minute observation checks for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The log is dated August 8, 2019, the night Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
The check sheets cover multiple tiers (G, H, J, K, M, L, ZB) within the SHU, indicating a standard procedure for monitoring high-risk or segregated inmates.
The instructions state inmates must be observed at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule, with rounds no more than 40 minutes apart.
Each sheet was to be reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of accountability for the observations.
